content=Patuxent River Naval Air Station is the Navy's primary aircraft test facility. Virtually every aircraft flown by the Navy since World War II has been testing at Pax River. The base is, of course, not open to the public, but you can visit the Naval Air Museum, which includes a large collection of jet-age Navy aircraft, including an F-14A, NF/A-18A, AV-8B Harrier II, and the two experimental aircraft that competed for the Joint Strike Fighter contract, the Boeing X-35C and the Lockheed-Martin X-32B. Visitors can walk up and touch the aircraft. Museum exhibits also include flight motion simulators.

content=Superb open-air sculpture garden, including many pieces on loan from the Smithsonian's Hirshorn Gallery.  The Garden offers rotating exhibitions in its indoor gallery place, as well as a gallery shop, snack bar, and classes.

Outdoor sculpture park associated with the Smithsonian Institute.  Shaded, beautiful and dog friendly walking path.

value: address=1175 Point Lookout Road, Scotland, MD 20687
directions=The park is at the southern tip of St. Mary's County, at the junction of the Potomac River and the Chesapeake Bay. It can be reached via Maryland Route 5.
hours=The park is open year-round. Camping and some other activities are seasonal.

price=October - April: $3.00/vehicle for MD resident and $4.00/vehicle non-resident.  May - September: Weekdays $3.00/vehicle for MD resident and $4.00/vehicle non-resident. Weekends and Holidays: $5.00/person for MD resident and $6.00/person non-resident

content=Point Lookout State Park sits at the southernmost tip of Maryland's western shore on a peninsula formed by the Chesapeake Bay and the Potomac River. Recreational opportunities abound in this picturesque Bay setting. Swimming, fishing, boating and camping are just a few of the activities to be enjoyed.

The park's peaceful surroundings belie its history as the location of a prison camp for more than 52,000 Confederate soldiers during the Civil War. A museum on site recounts this vivid history.
Hours: The park is open year-around. Camping and some other activities are seasonal. Civil War Ghosts wander.
directions=South on Rt 5 1/2mile before Pt Lookout State Park

content=Confederate Memorial Park was erected by the Decendents of those 52000+ imprisoned at the Union POW camp. Plaza with illuminated bronze statue,"Voices from the Pen" engraved first person accounts, 21 state and Confederate National flags,informational signage.
An appropriate memorial for the soldiers, sailor, marines and civilians imprisoned 1863-1865. Adjacent to the Federal and Maryland monument acre which contains the mass grave of the prisoners who died there.

This county is known for its miles of shoreline.  Two great beaches are on St. George Island.  One is right next to the bridge but the best is at the end of the Island, with a nice private campground and cottages.
